file_content.text: This is Cipher Nine to headquarters. Stand by for databank upload.
Watcher Three here. Standing by.
I have no loyalty to my former masters and I will transmit my information, but the result will not save you.
They planted me in Belsavis as a guardian, not as collector of their secrets.
The man in the kolto tank said your databanks would lead us to the enemy. Maybe you don't realize what you have.
You must know things, though.
You were built by them, weren't you?
How did they create you?
Assembled from machines beyond your comprehension and embedded with heuristic techniques.
After approximately one hundred fifty years of service as a mindless droid, I acquired true sentience. No memory wipe commenced.
You claim you aren't loyal, but you've worked awfully hard to stop me.
Don't try to protect them.
My position as jailer of Megasecurity Ward 23 provided challenges. These challenges forced my adaptation and growth into an evolved mentality.
I'm receiving, sir. The data formatting is unusual, but I found a log--visitations to the Megasecurity Ward, technology inventories....
Not much on its own, but it could be a way to verify or disprove anything else we've learned.
Cipher! Something hit us from the docking bay.
I shall observe your investigation with interest.
This is headquarters to Cipher Nine. Clearing your arrival with station control.
Cipher. You're now orbiting forty thousand kilometers above Belsavis--the Republic's largest penal colony. Fancy rebuilding your criminal reputation?
What does the Republic need with a jail the size of a planet?
Belsavis is a prison?
I thought you swapped your sense of humor for the promotion.
You remembered how to joke!
Only in part. Proceed, Watcher Three.
I've killed pirates on a half-dozen worlds. A few more shouldn't make a difference.
Depends how bloody it gets.
It's more than ex-pirates here, I'm afraid. Watcher Three?
Belsavis prison was built in secret to hold the galaxy's most dangerous individuals.
Three main levels, thousands of specialized cell blocks holding everyone from changelings to Sith Lords.
We've known of the prison's existence for nearly a year. Now we understand that the conspirators subverted Belsavis to their own use.
You say "subverted." Not infiltrated, not taken over.
Tell me what we know.
You sound pretty confident, given the circumstances.
How'd you figure that out?
It's all about following the record trail.
Won't they be shocked when I show up.
They're in for a surprise now.
If they're not, we have a problem.
The conspirators pulled strings with Republic higher-ups to construct a special section: Megasecurity Ward 23.
It's somewhere past the alien cells and the genocide ward... they built it and sealed it when Belsavis was founded. No one gets inside.
It's the highest-security area of the best-protected prison in the galaxy. You're going to break in and find what it's hiding.
Lay out our resources. How do we do this?
What's the plan?
I assume they've left more than a padlock to protect it.
Tell me about the security.
We don't know. The rest of the prison uses everything from lasers to force fields to sanitization gas.
You're assuming what's in there is worth finding.
This could be a fool's errand.
If you build a cell like that, it's because you can't afford intruders.
Two decades ago, a prison gang heard about the ward and tried to breach it, hoping something inside would help them escape.
Thieves, security experts--the underworld's best. None of them made it back, but they had the right idea.
You'll assemble your own gang from the prison. Establish yourself as a fellow inmate and succeed where the last group failed.
Lead the prisoners on a mission into their own jail. Understood.
Time to work.
Anyone particular in mind for my "gang"?
Who are these prisoners?
Taking prisoners along is liable to get us all killed.
You know I work better alone.
Sorry, sir. It's the best we could do on short notice.
You'll find supplies and a detailed dossier at our outpost on the planet surface.
Our military forces are encouraging riots as part of the war effort. It's distracting the Republic and should conceal your operation.
But don't be mistaken. The prisoners are not grateful. Keeper out.
With Keeper gone, sir, I'm afraid I'll have to brief you alone. Pulling our files on Belsavis prison now.
Start from the beginning. What sort of prison?
Belsavis is a prison?
Take your time, Watcher Three. I trust you can get this right.
I'm sure you'll do fine.
I... appreciate that.
If you're not prepared, you're not competent to brief me.
This is pathetic.
With due respect, sir--I'm doing the work of four Watchers.
Belsavis is a secret Republic penal colony, built for the most dangerous captives. Changelings, Sith Lords, mass murderers--all of them with special cells, special security.
Keeper believed the conspirators had subverted the prison and were somehow using it themselves. Files reference something called... "Megasecurity Ward 23."
High security zone, I'm assuming. Any details?
Guess that's our goal.
What does that mean? Are the conspirators running the place?
Subverted the prison?
I don't think so--they probably don't need to, if they can forge Republic documents. All the power, none of the responsibility.
You're trying my patience. Send me Keeper's files, I'll read them myself.
Tell me you've got something else
It isn't--I'm sorry. I do have a lead.
Keeper referred to the Megasecurity Ward as a type-zero site; built and used actively by the enemy.
Looks like it's been sealed for years, though. The best-protected spot in the galaxy's worst jail... the conspirators could have anything, anyone locked in there.
We've never even come close to conspirator territory before. This is big.
We'll finally see their turf.
I believe so, yes.
What's the setup? If there's food and water, it could have people. Just power, some sort of technology storage....
Can we guess what's inside?
Looks entirely self-contained--but it could have its own generators.
Perfect honeypot. Lure in your enemies, then lock them up.
It could be a trap.
Keeper always believed in springing traps, not avoiding them.
Now, you'll need a way in. Watcher Six had a log...
...twenty-four ships lost taking the Pyria system. Our victories are great, but our resources--
Wrong file.
Our infiltration operative on Belsavis reports a previous attempt to breach Megasecurity Ward 23 by a group of prisoners.
Evidently, they hoped to find resources for an escape attempt. None survived, but the theory is sound.
A Cipher agent could assemble a new gang and repeat the break-in attempt; our operative was to deliver a full proposal to the outpost. Status unknown.
Assemble a team of prisoners to breach their jail's Megasecurity Ward. I've heard worse plans.
So I'm going to lead a gang.
I was hoping there'd be more than that.
Does the message continue?
So was I, but the next entry goes back to reports from the front. Which... I should be reviewing.
Working with the scum of the galaxy again. On my way.
This'll be just like old times.
Our outpost she mentioned is being used by the military to stage a breakout; a Belsavis prison riot diverts Republic resources from the war.
Check our operative's drop point there, but mind the rioters. Watcher Three out.
